post.author: 김성욱
post.content: Vaadin is a relatively new and modern framework for web app development. I've just kickstart developing with it for another project, and it looks quite interesting. IMO, it is better than Struts, Stripes, Wicket, and Spring MVC in terms of getting away from silly JSP/HTML trivial (but huge amount of) jobs. Yes, Vaadin lets you work on serverside what you've mostly have done in those kind of presentations. Data Model wise, even though it supports a whole different way of JPA, I prefer the layered and traditional approach so far. Try some demo at their official website. It's free of course including the reference book. vaadin.com
post.title: Vaadin - web app framework
